title: Getting strange lag on wired business class internet
body:
I added a link so you can see a video showing my type of lag, keep in mind I see no FPS or MS changes when I get this lag and this does happen in any game I play (sometimes not as bad) [Youtube Link Here](https://youtu.be/tPqUs2BCZjI)

for spec's wise

On wired connection
Windows 10 64 bit
wired ethernet connection [Picture of my Adapter status](http://imgur.com/nzDQbxn)
Motherboard (where the ethernet is plugged into) MSI A78M-E35
CPU - A10-6800K
GPU - GTX 1060 6gb
HD - 240gb SSD SATA 6gbs (shouldn't be a problem)


I will also note my wife gets the same issues on her PC so that is why I'm thinking it's our internet. Also, my work, when I use my computer, will notice times I sound "roboty" also in discord while playing games there can be times I go "roboty" like my voice is having issues sending through the internet.

I have played it on the lowest settings confirming it's not a PC issue (at least I think)

I like to have friends over and host a fun get together tournament and I don't want this internet interfering with those events.
Help me Riot community and it's members, you're my only hope.

replies.body: Lag or input delays are usually connection problems, so your PC might be okay.  You could be having packet loss or some problem with how your ISP is routing to our game servers, but you can run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to really know for sure.  Try the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as well to troubleshoot any local possibilities or blocks to the game server.  Test it in a custom game and let me know the results.

Hi Porocles, 

first thanks for the fast reply, and two cool name

So I did go to that log reader and that was a great resource I did have to read that game I played and it showed these results [picture attached](http://imgur.com/a/Y5ktV)
MAJOR ISSUES so League agrees's something is wrong.

I went through all the steps it has told me and did even a reboot on the system I will be updating this post after a few games to see my result. However bottom line what I have seen here is it's my ISP providers fault and not league of legends or my PCs so thank you for the reply and for the time.

If there is anything I can maybe get as a keyword to explain to my ISP company that maybe would help them understand the issue cause i have a rented Modem and Router with them as well and it is business level/class.

Thanks for the kind words.  :D  I appreciate you getting back to me and the screenshot!  That is a lot of packet loss!  I'm glad you went through the connection guide, and I'm hoping it does the trick.  If the issue persists, we can run a traceroute to see how you're routing to the game server which you can give to your ISP for more context.  Let me know and we'll go from there.
